Author: omouse
Content: So devs will have to use JavaScript? Yuck. I'd rather they used Objective-C or Python or Ruby or something else.

Author: mdakin
Content:
I've used Camino 1.0.4 extensively but I've not looked at 1.5 yet. 1.0.4 is closer to what I want than Firefox is but it was not quite "there". Basic things like .pdf files NOT being viewed inside the browser bothered me. Maybe that's fixed in 1.5?

Point taken on OED vs. OAD. Regardless it's a fine dictionary and lookups are really fast.

Using the services menu to look up words is a good idea but I'd need to have a compelling reason to go though the effort of retraining myself. Plus the process will never be as fast and natural as a right-click.

The ad-blocking advantage of Firefox/Camino is not a compelling reason for me personally (at least now). So it's status-quo for me unless something changes.

Author: codeLullaby
Content:
Business 2.0 has implemented a flash based voting system to pick the Most Influential people(from their list!) .The sleek interface looks great, but actionscript that runs behind the scene is amazingly lame.

Exercising democracy is far more better than,editors handpicking a top 10 list over a pizza.But if the system built to exercise democracy is lame, then all your fun are belong to coders!

Hacking/breaking/gaming a live system is not really a cool thing to do. But what if the target is too lazy and careless ?

Title: Justin Kan #1 on Business 2.0's Most Influential People List (and i am responsible)
